introduction.title: CSS Introduction
description: CSS is the language used to style a web page and control the visual presentation of HTML documents.

core_concepts.definition: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets and is used to describe how HTML elements are displayed.
purpose: Adapt designs for different devices and screen sizes

key_points: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets.
CSS controls layout and visual presentation.

syntax.title: CSS Syntax
description: CSS syntax defines how CSS rules are written to style HTML elements.

selectors.title: CSS Selectors
description: CSS selectors define which HTML elements are styled.

how-to.title: How to Add CSS
description: CSS can be added to HTML documents in different ways.

comments.title: CSS Comments
description: CSS comments explain code and are ignored by browsers.

errors.title: CSS Errors
description: CSS errors occur due to incorrect syntax or invalid properties.

colors.title: CSS Colors
description: CSS colors define the visual color of elements.
